intro: Didymaea naniflora, commonly known as the small-flowered didymaea, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with a Mediterranean climate. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale blue or white flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
